items.title: Arrive Vaclav Havel Airport
items.detail: Flight arrives at PRG Terminal 1. Take Airport Express bus to Praha hlavni nadrazi (main station) for 100 CZK, or Uber/Bolt to Old Town ~400 CZK (25 min).

items.title: Check In — Old Town Hotel
items.detail: Hotel near Old Town Square. Drop bags and freshen up after flight. Walking distance to all major sights.

items.title: Lunch at Lokaal Dlouha
items.detail: Czech-European fusion in the Old Town. Try the svickova (marinated beef with cream sauce) or duck confit. Mains ~250–400 CZK ($11–18).

items.title: Prague Castle & St. Vitus Cathedral
items.detail: The world's largest ancient castle complex. Circuit B ticket (250 CZK) covers St. Vitus Cathedral, Old Royal Palace, St. George's Basilica, and Golden Lane. Allow 2–3 hours.

items.title: Walk Charles Bridge at Golden Hour
items.detail: The iconic 14th-century stone bridge lined with 30 baroque statues. Walk from the Castle side (Lesser Town) to Old Town. Best light for photos in late afternoon. Street musicians and artists along the way.

items.title: Czech Beer & Dinner at U Fleku
items.detail: Prague's oldest brewpub, operating since 1499. House-brewed dark lager and traditional Czech dishes. Try the roasted pork knee (veprove koleno). Budget ~500–700 CZK/person.

items.title: Old Town Square Night Walk
items.detail: See the illuminated Astronomical Clock, Tyn Church, and Old Town Hall. The square transforms beautifully at night. Great for photos.

items.title: Breakfast at Café Savoy
items.detail: Elegant Neo-Renaissance cafe with superb pastries, eggs benedict, and coffee. A Prague institution since 1893. Budget 250–400 CZK.

items.title: Jewish Quarter (Josefov) Walking Tour
items.detail: Visit the Old Jewish Cemetery, Spanish Synagogue, and Old-New Synagogue (Europe's oldest active). Combined ticket 350 CZK. Rich history spanning 700+ years.

items.title: Check Out & Head to Station
items.detail: Pack up, check out of hotel, and walk or taxi to Praha hlavni nadrazi (main train station). 15-min walk from Old Town.

items.title: Train: Prague → Budapest
items.detail: RegioJet or Czech Railways direct service. ~6.5 hours through Moravia and Slovakia. Comfortable seats, WiFi, cafe car. Tickets from ~$20 if booked ahead. Scenic route along the Danube into Budapest.

items.title: Arrive Budapest Keleti Station
items.detail: Budapest's main international terminal. Keleti is on Metro line M2 (red) or take a Bolt/Uber to hotel (~1,500 HUF / $4).

items.title: Check In — Budapest Hotel
items.detail: Hotel in the Jewish Quarter (District VII) — central location near ruin bars, restaurants, and metro. Walk to most sights.

items.title: Dinner & Ruin Bars
items.detail: Start at Szimpla Kert — the original and most famous ruin bar, built in an abandoned apartment complex. Eclectic decor, live music, street food stalls. Then wander the Jewish Quarter for more bars and restaurants. Budget 4,000–6,000 HUF ($11–17).

items.title: Breakfast at New York Café
items.detail: The most beautiful cafe in the world — opulent Italian Renaissance interior from 1894. Breakfast set ~5,000 HUF ($14). Worth it for the ambiance alone. Arrive early to avoid the queue.

items.title: Szechenyi Thermal Baths
items.detail: One of Europe's largest thermal bath complexes. Outdoor pools open year-round at 38°C. Entry ~7,500 HUF ($21) with locker. Arrive when it opens to enjoy the pools before crowds. Bring swimsuit and towel (or rent).

items.title: Lunch at Great Market Hall
items.detail: Budapest's largest indoor market in a stunning 19th-century iron hall. Ground floor: fresh produce, paprika, salami. Upper floor: food stalls with langos (fried dough with sour cream), goulash, and chimney cake. Budget 2,000–4,000 HUF.

items.title: Buda Castle & Fisherman's Bastion
items.detail: Take the funicular or walk up Castle Hill. Explore Buda Castle, then walk to Fisherman's Bastion for the best panoramic view of Budapest and Parliament across the river. Matthias Church nearby. Allow 2–3 hours.

items.title: Walk the Danube & Parliament
items.detail: Walk along the Danube embankment from Chain Bridge toward Parliament. Stop at the Shoes on the Danube Bank memorial. See the Parliament Building up close — Europe's largest. Best photos from the Buda side at sunset.

items.title: Gellert Hill Sunset
items.detail: Hike up Gellert Hill (20 min) for a 360-degree panorama of Budapest at golden hour. The Citadella fortress at the top and the Liberty Statue are iconic. Bring water — the climb is steep.

items.title: Farewell Dinner at Menza
items.detail: Modern Hungarian cuisine in a retro-communist chic setting. Try the duck leg with red cabbage or chicken paprikash. Excellent wine list of Hungarian varietals. Mains 3,500–6,000 HUF ($10–17).
